meta.name: Solomon to YT
meta.description: Upload solomon sensors to YT directory

parameters.description:
Job command line template. The template is written in [Freemarker Template Language](http://freemarker.org), using square bracket syntax.
* To access **source and destination MR paths**, use `${mr_input["<input's name>"]}` and `${mr_output["<output's name>"]}`:
    ```
    ${mr_input["..."]} => "//statbox/qloud-runtime-log/2016-04-04" (native path, e.g. YPath when using YT)
    ${mr_input["..."].raw} => "statbox/qloud-runtime-log/2016-04-04" (prefixless path for mapreduce binary, ${mapreduce})
    ${mr_input["..."].server} => plato.yt.yandex.net:80 (YaMR server/YT proxy for MR path)
    ${mr_input["..."].cluster} => plato (cluster name)
    ${mr_input["..."].host} => plato.yt.yandex.net (YaMR server/YT proxy host)
    ${mr_input["..."].port} => 80 (YaMR server/YT proxy port)

    ```
  * Paths are **normalized** before usage: empty path segments and leading/trailing slashes are removed. *E.g.*, `///a/b////c/` becomes `//a/b/c` when using YT, and `a/b/c` when using YaMR
  * Paths **need not be shell-quoted** because MR Processor requires all (normalized) paths to satisfy regexp `[A-Za-z0-9._-]+(/[A-Za-z0-9._-]+)*`
  * Destination MR paths are **generated automatically**. To influence their base path, see the `mr-output-path` option
* Substitute relevant mapreduce binary name with `${mapreduce}` and [MR runtime type](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/yt/cppwrapper/#usage) with `${mr_runtime}`
* Substitute YaMR server/YT proxy address with `${mr_cluster}` (also available: `${mr_cluster.name}`, `${mr_cluster.host}`, `${mr_cluster.port}`)
* Just like with Job Processor's `job-command`:
  * Substitute absolute paths to ordinary input files with `${input["<input's name>"]}`
  * Substitute absolute paths to ordinary output files with `${output["<input's name>"]}`
  * Substitute required options' values with `${param["<option's name>"]}`
  * Substitute optional options' values with `${param["<option's name>"]!<default value>}`
  * Remember to quote options of type `String` when passing them as command line arguments:
    * Shell-quote a single command line argument using `${param["string option"].bash}`
    * Shell-quote a string of command line arguments using `${param["string option"].args}`
  * If you need pipes (`|`) and redirection (`< > >>`):
    * Write `bash -c '<your command>'`
    * OR Write a [ba]sh script, specify it as the job's binary (`job-binary-url`) and run it as `./your_script_name`.
  * See https://nda.ya.ru/3QnJYz for more information.

Solomon program for selector. Use placeholder `{selectors}` to specify place for selectors from solomon-selectors option. For example,  `drop_empty_lines({selectors})`. More functions in solomon docs https://docs.yandex-team.ru/solomon/concepts/querying
parameters.label: solomon-expression

parameters.description: If your selector has many sensors, you can use this option to split selector using this labels.
parameters.label: solomon-partition-by-labels

parameters.description: If destination yt folder empty, this datetime will be used as start time for solomon data . Otherwise it will be from last yt table name
parameters.label: solomon-default-from-dttm

parameters.description: Seconds from current time which will be used for the end time for solomon data
parameters.label: solomon-now-lag

parameters.description: Page size in seconds for solomon data fetcher
parameters.label: solomon-page-size

parameters.description: TTL for yt tables in milliseconds. More info https://yt.yandex-team.ru/docs/description/common/cypress#TTL
parameters.label: yt-table-ttl

parameters.description:
Directory for output MR tables and directories.

Limited templating is supported: `${param["..."]}`, `${meta["..."]}`, `${mr_input["..."]}` (path to input MR *directory*) and `${uniq}` (= unique path-friendly string).

The default template for `mr-output-path` is

        home[#if param["mr-account"] != meta.owner]/${param["mr-account"]}[/#if]/${meta.owner}/nirvana/${meta.operation_uid}

If output path does not exist, it will be created.

Temporary directory, `${mr_tmp}`, is derived from output path in an unspecified way. It is ensured that:
  * It will exist before `job-command` is started
  * It need not be removed manually after execution ends. However, you **should** remove all temporary data created in `${mr_tmp}`, even if your command fails

MR account name (e.g. `rank_machine`) used to build MR output path for this operation.

See the `mr-output-path` option for more information

**Vanilla** jobs have **minimal dependencies** on their execution environment and **wait much less in scheduler queue** because they can run on more hosts, including search runtime container (RTC) VMs. Note that:
* Vanilla jobs **cannot access any network resources** besides YQL and public YT clusters (*e.g.*, `hahn`, `banach`, `freud`).
* Vanilla jobs can be **throttled or restarted *at any time***. When the job is restarted on the same host, Nirvana will clean up its working directory so that it looks like it started afresh.
* Vanilla jobs **run in a [minimal environment](https://nda.ya.ru/3RdpfC) *by default***. See https://nda.ya.ru/3RdpfC for instructions on installing additional packages and utilities.
